author: daniellehrner
content:
I would like your feedback, regarding a possible change to the rpc call `admin_nodeInfo`. Even though there does not exist any specification, it is at least implemented by geth,  Hyperledger Besu and Nethermind. Some libraries like web3j and web3.py support it as well.

While it provides various information about the node, one important information the ENR (Ethereum Node Record) is missing. We at Hyperledger Besu were thinking about including it, to support tooling to retrieve it and have a common RPC call to it in general.

One potential use case would be to retrieve the ENR of a node and check if it is included in discv4-dns-lists of the EF.

An alternative approach would be to add a new endpoint. We were thinking to call it `admin_enrInfo`, to use a similar naming pattern.

What do you think? Any feedback is welcome.

Geth admin_nodeInfo: https://geth.ethereum.org/docs/rpc/ns-admin#admin_nodeinfo
Besu admin_nodeInfo: https://besu.hyperledger.org/en/stable/Reference/API-Methods/#admin_nodeinfo
Nethermind admin_nodeInfo: https://docs.nethermind.io/nethermind/ethereum-client/json-rpc/admin#admin_nodeinfo
web3j admin_nodeInfo: https://javadoc.io/doc/org.web3j/core/latest/org/web3j/protocol/core/methods/response/admin/AdminNodeInfo.html
web3.py admin_nodeInfo: https://web3py.readthedocs.io/en/v4.0.0/web3.admin.html#web3.admin.nodeInfo

ENR EIP: https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-778

discv4-dns-lists: https://github.com/ethereum/discv4-dns-lists)
